alert.note: Alert for Cerro Gordo; Floyd; Worth (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 7:42PM CST until March 01 at 6:00PM CST by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Iowa... Winnebago River at Mason City affecting Worth, Floyd and Cerro Gordo Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Winnebago River at Mason City. * WHEN...Until Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, There is widespread flooding of city parks and water reaches the underside of the 12th Street Northeast bridge at the piers. At 11.0 feet, Sandbagging occurs on the dike from 12th Street Northeast to Carolina Street. At 12.0 feet, Widespread flooding occurs along the river. Some backwater effects are possible along Willow Creek between downtown Mason City and the confluence with the Winnebago river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM CST Monday the stage was 11.1 feet and rising. - Forecast...The river has reached flood stage and will continue to rise to a crest of 13.6 feet early tomorrow. It will then fall below flood stage early Wednesday afternoon. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 12.2 feet on 09/21/2018. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
